course_main_structural_unit.address:
Jakobi 2, IV korrus
51005 Tartu linn,

EST

description.en: This course is offered in a seminar-style format. We will read a an article or pair of articles each week on a given topic. Students are expected to present an article at least once during the semester and participate in discussions each week. Topics covered include more in-depth studies in the fields of phonetics, phonology, morphology and syntax.
description.et: Kursus on seminari stiilis. Loeme iga nädal ühte või kahte artiklit antud teemal. Iga üliõpilane vastutab ühe artikli esitamise ja arutelu modereerimise eest vähemalt üks kord semestri jooksul ning osaleb aktiivselt iga nädal arutelus. Teemad on seotud foneetika, fonoloogia, morfoloogia ja süntaksiga.

objectives.en: This is a seminar course intended for students who have a basic understanding of linguistics terminology and Estonian structure aiming to:
objectives.et: Seminari formaadis aine on mõeldud üliõpilastele, kes on õppinud algtasemel keeleteaduse terminoloogiat ja eesti keele struktuuri. Eesmärgiks on:

objectives.en: (a) deepen students' understanding of the structural characteristics of Estonian phonetics/phonology and morphosyntax;
objectives.et: süvendada üliõpilaste eesti keele foneetika/fonoloogia ja morfosüntaksi struktuuri puutuvaid teadmisi;

objectives.en: (b) provide experience reading and discussing papers in linguistics;
objectives.et: pakkuda kogemust keeleteaduslike artiklite lugemises ja arutamises;

objectives.en: (c) help students develop a framework to contextualise research that has been conducted on the Estonian language.
objectives.et: aidata üliõpilastel luua raamistik, et kontekstualiseerida eesti keele alaseid uurimistöid.

learning_outcomes.en: Students who have completed the course:
Will be able to analyse aspects of the linguistic structure of Estonian and compare them with other languages;
learning_outcomes.et: oskab eesti keele struktuuri eri aspekte analüüsida ja võrrelda teiste keeltega;

learning_outcomes.en: Will have gained experience in discussing empirical linguistic research;
learning_outcomes.et: omab kogemusi empiiriliste keeleteaduslike uuringute arutamises;

learning_outcomes.en: Will have a good understanding of the structure and contents of research papers in linguistics and linguistics terminology;
learning_outcomes.et: mõistab hästi keeleteaduslike artiklite struktuuri ja sisu ning keeleteaduslikku terminoloogiat;

learning_outcomes.en: Will be able to situate their own research plans in the context of earlier research on structural aspects of Estonian.
learning_outcomes.et: oskab iseenda uurimistöö plaane asetada varasemate uurimistööde konteksti.

independent_work.et:
Independent work: 
Maintaining a journal of academic terms
Reading one assigned article each week and participating in the class discussions.
Writing a summary of one of the articles (to be agreed in the first week) and preparing to lead discussion on that article in class.
Group presentation

Iseseisev töö:
Terminite päeviku pidamine
Iga nädal ühe artikli lugemine ja arutelus osalemine 
Semestri jooksul ühe artikli kohta kokkuvõtte kirjutamine ja selle seminari arutelu modereerimine
Rühmatöö esitlus

description.et:
E - 6-7 punkti 15st
D - 8-9 punkti 15st
C - 10-11 punkti 15st
B - 12-13 punkti 15st
A - 14-15 punkti 15st

grade_preconditions.et:
Participation in classwork and completion of the earlier assignments.

Kohalkäimine ja eelnevate tööde sooritamine

grade_evaluation.et:
15% 1st comprehension test
15% 2nd comprehension test
40% active participation, incl. Presenting one article and moderating that week's discussion in class
30% group work: presentation

15% esimene kontrolltöö
15% teine kontrolltöö
40% aktiivne osalus, sh artikli esitlus + arutelu modereerimine
30% rühmatöö: esitlus

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

topic.et: Phonetics and Phonology: Overview of the main phonological features of Estonian
Morphology and Syntax: Differential object marking
Morphology and Syntax: Grammatical voice and mood
Morphology and Syntax: Word order and complex clauses

audience.et: This course is intended primarily for students of the international MA programme EFUL (Estonian and Finno-Ugric Languages), but it is also open to students enrolled in other programmes.
